intro: Filago lojaconoi, commonly known as the Lojaconoi filago, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers that are usually pale yellow to white in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
